channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: 情報筋Xのリンダ・ヤカリーノCEOは、NFLやNBAの幹部との会談を含め、動揺する広告主を呼び戻すため、メディア業界とのつながりを頼りにしている（Wall Street Journal）。
item.description:
Wall Street Journal:
Sources: X CEO Linda Yaccarino is leaning on her media industry links to bring back jittery advertisers, including meeting executives from the NFL and the NBA  —  Media veteran drums up video deals with NFL, NBA and others as ‘training wheels’ for nervous brands

item.title: 中国を深くカバーする数少ない独立系英字出版物であるチャイナ・プロジェクトは、資金不足のため閉鎖を計画している（Martin Quin Pollard/Reuters）
item.description:
Martin Quin Pollard / Reuters:
The China Project, one of the few independently funded English-language publications to cover China in depth, plans to close due to a lack of funding  —  One of the few independently funded English-language publications to cover China in depth for Western audiences, “The China Project” …

item.title: RFE/RLのジェフリー・ゲドミン代表代行、ロシアが米国との捕虜交換の可能性のためにジャーナリスト、アルス・クルマシェワを「人質」に取ったとの懸念を表明（ロイター）
item.description:
Reuters:
RFE/RL acting president Jeffrey Gedmin expresses fears that Russia has taken journalist Alsu Kurmasheva “hostage” for a potential prisoner swap with the US  —  Radio Free Europe fears Russia has taken one of its journalists “hostage” for a potential prisoner swap with the United States …

item.title: 分析：2022年の音楽著作権収入は前年比14%増の$41.5B、作詞家、出版社、CMOが37%のシェア、デジタル収入は2019年から倍増（Will Page/Pivotal Economics）
item.description:
Will Page / Pivotal Economics:
Analysis: music copyright revenue grew 14% YoY to $41.5B in 2022, songwriters, publishers, and CMOs took a 37% share, and digital revenue has doubled since 2019  —  10-MINUTE READ  —  Purpose  —  First thing's first: Why do I go into a bat cave every October and calculate this figure?

item.title: SAG-AFTRA、AMPTPの最新契約提示の「いくつかの必須項目」に問題提起：高収入組合員のAI保護が重要なハードルのまま（The Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
The Hollywood Reporter:
SAG-AFTRA takes issue with “several essential items” in the AMPTP's latest contract offer; sources: AI protections for high-earning members remain a key hurdle  —  According to multiple sources familiar with the state of the negotiations, entertainment companies are seeking to pay for scans, but not their use or re-use.

item.title: メタ社は、米議員らが誤った情報の拡散に警告を発したことを受け、同社の新しいジェネレーティブAI広告製品を政治広告主が使用することを禁止する計画だ（ケイティ・ポール／ロイター）。
item.description:
Katie Paul / Reuters:
Meta plans to bar political advertisers from using its new generative AI advertising products, after US lawmakers warn against the spread of misinformation  —  Facebook owner Meta (META.O) is barring political advertisers from using its new generative AI advertising products …

item.title: TikTokは、米国、英国、ドイツ、フランスのクリエイターを対象とした10億ドルのクリエイターファンドが2023年12月16日に終了すると発表、イタリアとスペインのクリエイターは影響を受けない（Mia Sato/The Verge）
item.description:
Mia Sato / The Verge:
TikTok says its $1B creator fund will end on December 16, 2023, for creators in the US, the UK, Germany, and France; creators in Italy and Spain aren't affected  —  TikTok's $1 billion creator fund will come to an end on December 16th, 2023, the company told users today.

item.title: Metaによると、Instagramのクリエイターのアクティブなサブスクリプションは、サブスクリプション機能の開始からわずか1年強で1Mに達し、新しいクリエイターツールを発表した（Jacob Kastrenakes/The Verge）。
item.description:
Jacob Kastrenakes / The Verge:
Meta says there are now 1M active subscriptions to Instagram creators, just over a year after launching the subscriptions feature, and unveils new creator tools  —  There are now 1 million paid subscriptions to creators on Instagram, slowly transforming the platform into a space where creators can get paid directly by their fans.

item.title: YouTube、コメント要約や会話型レコメンドツールなど、Premiumユーザー向けのジェネレーティブAI機能をまずは米Androidでテスト予定（Sarah Perez/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Sarah Perez / TechCrunch:
YouTube plans to test generative AI features for Premium users, like a comments summarizer and a conversational recommendations tool, first on Android in the US  —  YouTube will begin to experiment with new generative AI features, the company announced today.

item.title: OpenAIがCopyright Shieldを発表、ChatGPT EnterpriseユーザーとOpenAIの顧客で、同社のサービスに関連する著作権侵害の申し立てに直面している人を守ることを約束（Kyle Wiggers/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Kyle Wiggers / TechCrunch:
OpenAI debuts Copyright Shield, promising to defend ChatGPT Enterprise users and OpenAI customers facing copyright infringement claims related to its services  —  OpenAI — bowing to peer pressure — today announced it'll step in and defend businesses using OpenAI products …

item.title: ジェイソン・ワゲンハイムがBDGメディアを退社し、2026年のワールドカップ開催を前に、サッカーサイトを所有するフットボールコ社の北米初のCEOに就任（Sara Fischer/Axios）
item.description:
Sara Fischer / Axios:
Jason Wagenheim leaves BDG Media to become the first North America CEO of Footballco, which owns soccer websites, ahead of the 2026 World Cup on the continent  —  Jason Wagenheim is leaving BDG Media, the parent company of Bustle and a slew of other female-focused lifestyle brands …

item.title: CBS News and Stationsは、クラウディア・ミルンSVPとロス・デーガンEVPが共同して、誤報とディープフェイクを調査するCBS News Confirmedを立ち上げる（Brian Steinberg/Variety）
item.description:
Brian Steinberg / Variety:
CBS News and Stations launches CBS News Confirmed to examine misinformation and deepfakes, co-led by SVP Claudia Milne and EVP Ross Dagan  —  CBS' news-and-stations division will launch a new unit to examine misinformation and so-called “deepfakes,” or false videos that can often be generated via artificial intelligence.

item.title: ピューリッツァー賞委員会、受賞対象を放送・音声機関が運営するデジタルニュースサイトのジャーナリズム記事にも拡大（Editor and Publisher誌）
item.description:
Editor and Publisher:
The Pulitzer Prize Board expands its awards' eligibility to include written journalism from digital news sites operated by broadcast and audio organizations  —  The Pulitzer Prize Board has decided to expand eligibility for its journalism awards to digital news sites operated by broadcast and audio organizations.

item.title: タイムスタジオ、コンテンツスタジオEverWonder立ち上げのため退社したイアン・オレフィスの後任として、Majordomo Mediaの共同設立者デイブ・オコナーを社長に指名（Matt Grobar/Deadline）
item.description:
Matt Grobar / Deadline:
Time Studios names Majordomo Media co-founder Dave O'Connor as its president, replacing Ian Orefice, who left to launch the content studio EverWonder  —  - Crazy Legs Developing Prince Biopic Based On First Wife Mayte Garcia's Memoir ‘The Most Beautiful’  — Good Deed Entertainment …

item.title: ガネットが初のテイラー・スウィフトのフルタイム記者としてブライアン・ウェストを採用、テネシアン紙のニュースルームからUSAトゥデイ紙やガネットの他の地方紙で働く（Chris Willman/Variety）
item.description:
Chris Willman / Variety:
Gannett hires Bryan West as its first full-time Taylor Swift reporter, who'll work from The Tennessean's newsroom for USA Today and other Gannett local dailies  —  Gannett, the biggest newspaper chain in the U.S., no longer has a blank space under the title of “Taylor Swift reporter.”
